definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: Trades that sat in opposition to the orgy of money printing by the Fed.
sentences.chinese: 针对美联储印钞狂欢进行的逆向交易值得一提。

sentences.english: But its indelible characters and set-pieces still deserve mention.
sentences.chinese: 然而书中不朽的人物和场景设置仍值得一提。

sentences.english: Another thing about Kathy is that she is a devout Christian.
sentences.chinese: 还有件事情值得一提，就是她是一名虔诚的基督徒。

sentences.english: Other noteworthy features include unlimited storage and support for twenty languages.
sentences.chinese: 其他值得一提的特色包括不限容量及20种语言支持。

sentences.english: Another formulation which is worth mentioning here is ‘Hydroxycut’.
sentences.chinese: 在这里值得一提的另一种减肥药是“海德卡特”。

sentences.english: But most notably for Wang, he set a career high with 10 strikeouts.
sentences.chinese: 但对王最值得一提的，是他创生涯新高的10次三振。

sentences.english: The ability to enable and disable the extensions in the Extension Manager is worth mentioning.
sentences.chinese: 在扩展管理器中启用和禁用扩展的能力是值得一提的。

sentences.english: There are a few other putative subspecies of Caiman crocodilus worth mentioning.
sentences.chinese: 有几个其他假定亚凯门鳄鳄值得一提。

sentences.english: Was her "Vindication of the Rights of Woman" unmentionable?
sentences.chinese: 是她的“女性权利论辩”不值得一提？

sentences.english: Admittedly this isn't that impressive given the amount of resources spent.
sentences.chinese: 不可否认，这不值得一提，因为为此耗费了大量资源。

sentences.english: Reading is the only hobby I can speak of.
sentences.chinese: 读书是我唯一值得一提的爱好。

sentences.english: The theoreticians of the Comintern are not even worth mentioning.
sentences.chinese: 共产国际的理论家根本就不值得一提。

sentences.english: This is a polite way of speech, meaning being not worth mentioning.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种很谦虚的说法，意思就是说不值得一提。

sentences.english: In fact, the its achievement in Guzici is also worth mentioning.
sentences.chinese: 其实他在鼓子词方面的成就也值得一提。

definition: apart from this/in addition to this
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
